page.title: 15SHUTE HOUSE AND SHUTE BARTON
page.content: The earliest building on the site dating from about 1380 was built by Sir William Bonville who was Sheriff of Devon in 1390 and he died in 1408. The rooms of chief interest are the great kitchen on the ground floor with its enormous fire place. In 1829 this housed a specially built spit for roasting 2 oxen on the occasion of John Poles 21st birthday.It was said that thousands of estate workers and villagers from miles around were entertained at the party. The approach drive to Shute Barton is through the Tudor Gate house. Shute house used to be a girls school but now it is made into flats. It is a large,white house and can be seen from miles around,especially from the south side of our area.
